name: John Pennekamp Coral Reef State Park
description: Renowned for its underwater coral formations and marine life.

name: Carysfort Reef
description: Known for its pristine corals and underwater beauty.
whatToExpect: Witness stunning coral gardens and a diverse marine environment, including colorful reef fish.

name: French Reef
description: Offers diverse marine life and interesting coral formations.
whatToExpect: Enjoy a vibrant reef with marine diversity, sponges, and various species of fish.

name: Molasses Reef
whatToExpect: Expect to see vibrant coral formations, colorful fish, and clear waters. Look out for parrotfish, angelfish, and nurse sharks. Approximately 4 miles offshore.
description: Part of the Florida Keys National Marine Sanctuary with diverse marine species. Known for beautiful coral gardens and marine life.

name: Carysfort Reef
description: Known for elkhorn and staghorn coral formations, and sea turtles.

name: Horseshoe Reef
description: Features unique underwater structures and marine diversity.
whatToExpect: Explore unique reef structures, swim-throughs, and diverse marine life, including groupers and snapper.

name: Davis Reef
description: Known for its vibrant corals and marine biodiversity.
whatToExpect: Discover colorful coral formations, sponges, and a variety of marine species, including parrotfish and angelfish.

name: Dry Rocks
description: Offers diverse marine life and interesting coral formations.
whatToExpect: Experience coral formations and diverse marine species, including colorful fish and sea fans.

name: Christ of the Deep
description: A famous underwater statue in the John Pennekamp Coral Reef State Park.
whatToExpect: View the iconic Christ of the Deep statue submerged in clear waters amidst marine life and coral formations. Accessible from the shore, located near John Pennekamp Coral Reef State Park.

name: Grecian Rocks
description: A shallow reef ideal for snorkelers with colorful marine life.
whatToExpect: Snorkel in shallower waters with an abundance of coral and tropical fish species.

name: John Pennekamp Coral Reef State Park
description: Florida's first underwater park with diverse marine ecosystems.
whatToExpect: Explore diverse coral ecosystems and a variety of marine life, including tropical fish and sea turtles.

name: Looe Key Reef
description: A renowned marine sanctuary with colorful coral and fish.
whatToExpect: Discover a protected marine environment with abundant coral and fish species, including parrotfish and snapper.

name: Sombrero Reef
description: Home to diverse marine life and stunning coral formations.
whatToExpect: Encounter a variety of coral species and marine life, including colorful parrotfish and angelfish.

name: Alligator Reef
description: A historic location with vibrant marine ecosystems. Impressive coral formations and diverse marine species.
whatToExpect: Explore a historic reef with coral formations, a variety of fish, and the Alligator Reef Light.

name: Mosquito Bay, Key West
description: Known for its bright bioluminescent displays, especially during the summer.

name: Indian Key Channel, Islamorada
description: This area often has bioluminescent plankton, creating a stunning natural light show.

name: Banana Bay, Marathon
description: Another spot where you can witness bioluminescent waters, particularly in the summer and early fall.
